docs.lead_paragraph: Since 2000, the middle-class share of households has narrowed as more have fallen to the bottom of the economic ladder.

headline.main: Middle Class Shrinks Further as More Fall Out Instead of Climbing Up
headline.print_headline: More Fall Out as Middle Class Shrinks Further

docs.abstract: Number of middle-class households, or those making $35,000 to $100,000 annually, continues to narrow since 2000 as more fall down the economic ladder; at same time, increasingly fewer of the 53 million households remaining in middle class, or about 43 percent of total, fit traditional image of married couple raising children.
docs.snippet: Since 2000, the middle-class share of households has narrowed as more have fallen to the bottom of the economic ladder.

byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and ROBERT GEBELOFF

docs.lead_paragraph: A New York State statute to protect the infirm has become a routine tool for nursing homes to ensure bills are paid.

headline.main: To Collect Debts, Nursing Homes Are Seizing Control Over Patients
headline.print_headline: To Collect Debts, Seizing Control Over Patients

docs.abstract: New York nursing homes are now routinely leveraging state's guardianship statute as they seek to force families to pay bills; law, which transfer's a person's legal rights and decision-making power to a court appointee, was originally intended to protect those who are incapable of managing their own affairs; nursing homes are now using the statute instead as a powerful debt collection tool in compelling families to pay disputed bills.
docs.snippet: A New York State statute to protect the infirm has become a routine tool for nursing homes to ensure bills are paid.

docs.lead_paragraph: Key provisions include creating a global cadre of emergency health workers, establishing a fund that could be tapped quickly, and support for the development of treatments for emerging infectious diseases.

headline.main: W.H.O. Members Endorse Resolution to Improve Response to Health Emergencies
headline.print_headline: Criticized on Ebola, U.N. Agency Backs Changes to Improve Its Emergency Response

docs.abstract: World Health Organization, responding to criticism of slow and ineffective action on Ebola epidemic, backs changes to fortify its emergency response to outbreaks and other health crises.
docs.snippet: Key provisions include creating a global cadre of emergency health workers, establishing a fund that could be tapped quickly, and support for the development of treatments for emerging infectious diseases.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representatives of the United Steelworkers union (USW) and oil companies have completed five days of talks as of Sunday for a new national contract that will cover hourly workers at 63 U.S. refineries that account for 64 percent of national refining capacity.

headline.main: Factbox: U.S. Refinery Worker Proposals and Past Negotiations
headline.print_headline: Factbox: U.S. Refinery Worker Proposals and Past Negotiations

docs.lead_paragraph: Day by day, meal by meal, training children to cope with Prader-Willi syndrome, a rare genetic form of obesity.

headline.main: ‘Food Is a Death Sentence to These Kids’

docs.abstract: Rachelle Williams is 13-year-old diagnosed with Prader-Willi Syndrome, one of few genetic causes of obesity, and is in program at Children's Institute of Pittsburgh that teaches those with disorder how to manage it; disease has range of symptoms, most prominent of which is heightened, permanent sensation of hunger.
docs.snippet: Day by day, meal by meal, training children to cope with Prader-Willi syndrome, a rare genetic form of obesity.

docs.lead_paragraph: The anchor has brought Fox News a more unpredictable approach to red-meat politics. Can she draw a more unpredictable audience?
docs.abstract: Profile of Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly, whose show The Kelly File is the channel's biggest new hit in 13 years; Kelly's popularity among wide range of viewers may point way for channel to grow its aging demographic.
docs.snippet: The anchor has brought Fox News a more unpredictable approach to red-meat politics. Can she draw a more unpredictable audience?

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Ben Carson is appealing to Iowa conservatives with messages about securing the country's borders and cracking down on employers who hire immigrants illegally.

headline.main: At Iowa Conservatives' Event, Carson Hits Immigration Theme
headline.print_headline: At Iowa Conservatives' Event, Carson Hits Immigration Theme

docs.snippet: Dr. Ben Carson is appealing to Iowa conservatives with messages about securing the country's borders and cracking down on employers who hire immigrants illegally.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. biotechnology company Gilead has conceded its first discounts in Germany on its key hepatitis C drugs Sovaldi and Harvoni, German business weekly WirtschaftsWoche reported.

headline.main: German Insurers Win Discounts on Gilead's Sovaldi
headline.print_headline: German Insurers Win Discounts on Gilead's Sovaldi

docs.snippet: U.S. biotechnology company Gilead has conceded its first discounts in Germany on its key hepatitis C drugs Sovaldi and Harvoni, German business weekly WirtschaftsWoche reported.
